The Cosmopolitan Affair

In January 2016, Defendant Shift4 Corporation (“Shift4”) was formerly known as Lighthouse
Network, LLC (“LHN”). Unknown to Card Connect, LHN was engaged in discussions with
one of Card Connect’s largest independent sales organizations (“ISOs”), NextPay, LLC.
The relationship between Card Connect and NextPay was governed by an ISO
Agreement (“NextPay ISO Agreement”). Another company, POS Portal, LLC, was also a
party to the NextPay ISO Agreement. The NextPay ISO Agreement prohibited solicitation
of LHN employees for a period of two (2) years following termination.

Also unknown to Card Connect, on Tuesday, January 19, 2016, Jared Isaacman, chief
executive officer (“CEO”) of LHN, met with John R. Dorsey (“JDR”), a former Card Connect
executive, in Atlantic City, New Jersey. JDR then flew to Las Vegas, Nevada, on Wednesday,
January 20, 2016. Also, on Wednesday, January 20, 2016, and unbeknownst to Card Connect,
LHN and NextPay executed a non-binding letter of intent (“LOI”) for LHN to acquire certain
assets of NextPay.

Jared Isaacman flew to Las Vegas on Friday, January 22, 2016, to attend a UFC fight that
started in Atlantic City. On Saturday, January 23, 2016, Jared Isaacman ran into John Unwin,
CEO of The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas, while having dinner. Upon information and belief,
JDR, Angela Carr, and Sam Kaplan, all former Card Connect employees that migrated to
NextPay, were also in Las Vegas that weekend.

On Wednesday, January 27, 2016, JDR emailed Sam Kaplan, the current NextPay chief
operating officer (“COO”) concerning the flight arrangements to Las Vegas.
From:Sent: To: Subject:
John Dorsey
Wednesday, January 27, 2016 9:12 AM
Sam Kaplan
RE: Flight

How you doing?

Just wanted to keep this on your ra er..My flight info for tomorrow is:
AA Flt# [REDACTED]
